2. Common mutant TSD gene: This refers to a specific mutation in the TSD gene. Again, without more context, it is impossible to determine the disease or condition associated with this mutation.
3. Rare (allelic) mutant gene: This likely refers to a different mutation in the same TSD gene or a different gene that is allelic (i.e., located near or linked to the TSD gene) and causes a similar condition. Without more context, it is impossible to determine the exact disease or condition associated with this mutation.
